question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: safe_get_table()] [Index validation bypass] At lines 647-656, table index bounds are checked - but can an attacker exploit TOCTOU (time-of-check-time-of-use) issues if the table is modified between validation and access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: is_valid_view_function()] [Return type bypass] Lines 385-388 check that view functions have non-empty return signatures - can an attacker craft a function with Unit return type that passes this check but violates view function semantics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: is_valid_view_function()] [Visibility bypass] The function checks functions exist in the map at line 384 but doesn't verify visibility - can private or internal functions be marked as view functions to bypass access controls? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: is_valid_unbiasable_function()] [Entry function bypass] Lines 366-367 require entry=true and non-public visibility - can an attacker mark a public function with randomness attribute to bypass unbiasability checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: is_valid_unbiasable_function()] [Randomness manipulation] This validates randomness attributes but doesn't check function parameters - can an attacker create a randomness function that takes attacker-controlled inputs to bias the randomness? [File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: is_valid_resource_group()] [Ability bypass] Line 408 checks for AbilitySet::EMPTY - can an attacker craft a struct with abilities that appear empty due to bit manipulation but actually have hidden abilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: is_valid_resource_group()] [Type parameter bypass] Line 409 checks type_parameters.is_empty() - can generic structs with default type parameters bypass this check and violate resource group invariants? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: is_valid_resource_group()] [Field count manipulation] Lines 404-411 check for exactly 1 field - can an attacker use StructFieldInformation::DeclaredVariants to have multiple fields that appear as one? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: is_valid_resource_group()] [Native struct bypass] Line 405 treats Native structs as having 0 fields - can native structs be marked as resource groups to bypass validation entirely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: is_valid_resource_group_member()] [Key ability check] Line 429 only checks for Key ability - can structs with Key but without Store ability be used as resource group members to violate Move's type safety? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: is_valid_resource_group_member()] [Ability combination attack] Does the validation ensure resource group members can't have Drop ability, which would allow destroying resources and causing fund loss? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: verify_module_metadata_for_module_publishing()] [Feature flag TOCTOU] Lines 445-447 check SAFER_METADATA feature flag - can an attacker exploit race conditions where the flag changes between check and use, bypassing complexity validation? [File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: verify_module_metadata_for_module_publishing()] [Multiple attribute bypass] Lines 469-481 allow multiple attributes per function - can conflicting attributes (view + randomness) coexist and cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/module_metadata.rs] [Function: verify_module_metadata_for_module_publishing()] [Unknown attribute injection] Lines 475-479 reject unknown function attributes - but can an attacker bypass this by encoding known attribute kinds with unexpected args? (Medium)
